body:
Adding a symlink inside the container is a workaround, those symlinks should only be there for development purposes. Also, if the CUDA ABI breaks you will run into troubles.

I'm pretty sure the only change required is adding `.1` [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc#L72).
It's already done correctly for the other CUDA libraries I guess you just missed this one.
